bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, October 1, 1907

div1.p: The Kissingers thank Kelly for his financial support. John Kissinger does not regret taking part in the experiment.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, October 1, 1907
div1.p:
your good kind
letter at hand and we are certainly
very greatful to you for your and
other kind friends contributions-
you ask if you should send the
Rest of the amount now will say
to you do as you feel is justified I
know you are doing for the best I am
sure we will be very careful about
how every cent goes for we certainly know
the value of money and at this time
Ms Kissinger has given out entirely
and canot help at all we shall
try to find a place with less rent
and I shall do sewing its the
2
least of my thoughts to quit work
and look to others for Support
I shall do all I can.

the Lord is good to us and
in this trying time he has
Certainly come to us in our
Sorrow and we Shall Strive to
Serve him more and more
I know my daily Prayers have
been my Strength. May the Lord
bless you: Is our Prayer:
we read where (Major) (Dr Carrol)
had died and It made Mr. Kissinger
feel very bad to hear of his Death
he said he felt he Should have
been spared to finish his good
work for Humanity but God
Knows best-

I have talked to Mr Kissinger
a Great many times about
3
his affliction and he never
once says he regrets having
had the experiment he says
Christ Sufferd and died on
the Cross to Save the world
and why Should he Regret
being an Invalid to help Save
many lives from the Dread
Yellow Fever- will thank you
for your kindness and send
best Regards from your friends
